article.title: Back to the seminal Deutsch algorithm

multiple_choice_question.text: This table represents the set of functions used in Deutsch\'s algorithm. Which of the following statements about these functions is **incorrect**?
choices: `fo1(a)` and `f10(a)` are balanced functions, having an equal number of zeros and ones as output.
The input `a` can be either 0 or 1.
`f10(a)` always outputs the same value as its input `a`.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the initial quantum state of the three registers used in Deutsch\'s algorithm. What does the subscript "B" in  `|01⟩B`  indicate?
choices: The value of the qubit in register B.
The superposition state of register B.
That register B is in a balanced state.
The specific register being referred to.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the final state of the quantum registers after applying Deutsch\'s algorithm. What does the state of register A (`|1⟩A`)  reveal about the function chosen by Bob?
What is the main advantage of Deutsch\'s algorithm compared to its classical counterpart?
choices: It can solve a wider range of problems.
It provides a more accurate solution.
It is easier to implement on a physical quantum computer.
